00022 #ifndef CHIPSUMMARY_H
00023 #define CHIPSUMMARY_H
00024 
00025 #include <cstring>
00026 #include <string>
00027 #include <utility>
00028 #include <vector>
00029 //
00030 
00031 ///@todo AW: This is a bit of a mess because we had to add in after the fact
00032 ///          the need to know up front what metrics will be available. Originally
00033 ///          the list of available metrics (eg getMetricNames) was only available
00034 ///          after the analysis was run.
00035 
00036 /** 
00037  * Class for objects that provide chip summary metrics. This is basically
00038  * an interface with some helper methods for exposing per-chip metrics
00039  * to various reporters.
00040  */
00041 class ChipSummary {
00042   public:
00043 
00044     /**
00045     * Class for storing metrics
00046     */
00047     class Metric {
00048         public:
00049       /// @todo Could we have a more generic name?
00050       enum Type {Unset, Integer, Double, String};
00051 
00052       Metric();
00053       Metric(std::string name, int value);
00054       Metric(std::string name, double value);
00055       Metric(std::string name, std::string value);
00056       //Metric& operator=(const Metric& metric);
00057 
00058       std::string m_Name;
00059       Type m_Type;
00060       double      m_Double;
00061       int         m_Integer;
00062       std::string m_String;
00063       // @todo add docstring to header of report file.
00064       // std::string m_docstring
00065     };
00066 
00067   class MetricDef {
00068   public:
00069     std::string  m_name;
00070     Metric::Type m_type;
00071     int          m_precision;
00072 
00073     MetricDef(const std::string& name,Metric::Type type) {
00074       m_name=name;
00075       m_type=type;
00076       m_precision=-1;
00077     };
00078     MetricDef(const std::string& name,Metric::Type type,int precision) {
00079       m_name=name;
00080       m_type=type;
00081       m_precision=precision;
00082     };
00083   };
00084 
00085   typedef std::vector<Metric> metricVec_t;
00086   typedef std::vector<MetricDef> metricDefVec_t;
00087 
00088     /**
00089     * Constructor
00090     */
00091     ChipSummary();
00092 
00093     /**
00094     * DeConstructor
00095     */
00096     virtual ~ChipSummary();
00097 
00098     /**
00099     * Get vector of metrics
00100     */
00101   metricVec_t getMetrics(int chip);
00102 
00103     /**
00104     * Get named metric
00105     */
00106     bool getMetric(int chip, std::string name, Metric &metric);
00107 
00108     /**
00109     * Get vector of metric names -- This will exactly match the number and order
00110     * of metrics returned by getMetrics().
00111     */
00112     metricDefVec_t getMetricDefs();
00113 
00114     /** 
00115     * Is the summary information valid/set
00116     */
00117     bool isValid();
00118     
00119   protected:
00120     /** 
00121     * Set Valid State
00122     */
00123     bool setValid(bool setTo);
00124     
00125   private:
00126     /**
00127     * Check that the metric available matches the predefined list
00128     */
00129   void checkStat(Metric &metric, const ChipSummary::MetricDef& metricdef);
00130 
00131 public:  
00132   void declareMetric(const ChipSummary::MetricDef& metricdef);
00133   void declareMetric(const std::string& metric_name,Metric::Type metric_type);
00134   void declareMetric(const std::string& metric_name,Metric::Type metric_type,int precision);
00135 
00136   void declareMetrics(const ChipSummary::metricDefVec_t& metricDefVec);
00137 
00138   int metricNameToIndex(const std::string& metric_name);
00139   ChipSummary::Metric* getMetricPtr(int chipIdx,const std::string& metric_name);
00140 
00141   // Why enforce an order? Have the program reorder them.
00142   void setMetric(int chipIdx,const ChipSummary::Metric& metric);
00143   void setMetric(int chipIdx,const std::string& metric_name,int val);
00144   void setMetric(int chipIdx,const std::string& metric_name,double val);
00145   void setMetric(int chipIdx,const std::string& metric_name,const std::string& val);
00146   //
00147   void setMetrics(int chipIdx,const ChipSummary::metricVec_t& metrics);
00148 
00149   //
00150   int getSummaryStatsSize();
00151   int setSummaryChipCount(int cnt);
00152   int getSummaryChipCount();
00153   //
00154   int setNextChipIdx(int idx);
00155   int getNextChipIdx();
00156 
00157   // a comment to 
00158   void addHeaderComment(const std::string& comment);
00159   std::vector<std::string> getHeaderComments();
00160 
00161 private:
00162   /// Vector of the metrics to be reported
00163   /// use "declareMetric".
00164   ChipSummary::metricDefVec_t m_MetricDefs;
00165 
00166   std::vector<std::string> m_headercomments;
00167 
00168 protected:
00169   /// Stats for ChipSummary
00170   std::vector<ChipSummary::metricVec_t> m_SummaryStats;
00171   int m_SummaryChipCount;
00172   
00173   int m_nextChipIdx;
00174 
00175 private:
00176     /// Are the summary states ready for consumption
00177     bool m_Valid;
00178 
00179 };

00181 #endif /* CHIPSUMMARY_H */
